intro: Alsomitra suberosa, commonly known as the hairy alsomitra, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and clustered leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are often borne in umbels, followed by small, fleshy fruits. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
